column4: clean install of 12.04 and system still only recognizing 4GB out of 8GB, any suggestions on getting it to recognize all 8?
are you installing 32bit ubuntu and not using PAE?
system should recognize all 8 w/ 64bit right?
how are you viewing your ram?
install pastebinit and run: cat $(uname -a) $(free -m)|pastebinit -b http://paste.ubuntu.com
install pastebinit and run: echo $(uname -a) $(free -m)|pastebinit -b http://paste.ubuntu.com
i'm still a bit of a noob.  pastebinit is now installed and i'm trying to run the commands you pasted.  please bear with me
i can't get that command line to run
install pastebinit and run: echo "$(uname -a) $(free -m)" | pastebinit -b http://paste.ubuntu.com
I honestly have no clue. I've never heard of that problem. do other OS's pick it up?
this was a windows machine prior to this and it recognized all 8
they are 4GBx2.  I have two other slots open, maybe i'll try those two and see if it is a mb issue
RAM stick said 4GB on it and in smaller letters it said 2GBx2
